alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 10:11PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Phelps, western Kearney, Buffalo, southeastern Gosper, southeastern Dawson, eastern Furnas and Harlan Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1011 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Amherst to near Loomis to near Oxford. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Amherst around 1015 PM CDT. Miller around 1025 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Atlanta, Odessa, Elm Creek and Bertrand. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 245 and 276. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps
